sentences.english: Surgent power output of All New Bora makes your driving pleasure easy on the trigger.

sentences.english: Feel it in your chest, the syllables get pumpin.

sentences.english: A cavity blood, nowhere to flow, an upsurge of emotion, such as surge.

sentences.english: He wrote an exciting eulogy for the celebrations on the Double Tenth Day.

sentences.english: At this moment, Ms Ling Xiaoming contemplated a lot.

sentences.english: Nervousness or exuberant outbursts of emotion are not usually associated with Virgos.

sentences.english: Americanos faith in freedom exclusived democrair conditioning unity was a rock in a rage sea.

sentences.english: If you are not burned to ashes, you will then be able to philosophize lyrically.

sentences.english: The teacher soon whipped the students into a fever of excitement.

sentences.english: However, today the economy of billowy reforms spring tide in.

definition: to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
